definition: to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: He's deeply engrossed in physical research.
sentences.chinese: 他醉心于物理学的研究。

sentences.english: He remained gloomy, narrow and hopelessly addicted to conventional wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 他依旧阴郁，险隘，无可救药地醉心于传统的智慧中。

sentences.english: Rothschild is revelling in the fruits of its conservatism.
sentences.chinese: 洛希尔醉心于保守理念带来的甜头儿。

sentences.english: Jack is enamoured with scientific researches.

definition: to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be keen on/to have a passion for
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
